direction.raw_text: "We've Only Just Begun," Mrs. Bruce crouches next to her wildly-ancient entertainment center complete with 8-track. She flips the first record forward on her Ronco Record Mate. Album after album flaps forward. Olivia Newton-John, Neil Diamond, the Osmond Brothers. She stops on the Carpenters and sighs at the serene cover art. Just what the doctor ordered. Placing the vinyl on the turntable, she CLICKS the dustcover closed and FLICKS "Play." Reclining in her Lazyboy, she sips her wine, opens the book and awaits the mellow tones of Karen Carpenter. Suddenly, her eardrums are hammered by machine gun GUITAR. Caustic ROCK 'N' ROLL assaults her senses. She jumps, spilling her wine all over herself. This isn't the Carpenters...

Running to the rear of the huge console, she stretches to reach the plug, but can't. Fingertips millimeters away. As the cacophony POUNDS she shakes the entire stereo with all her frantic might.

dialogue.raw_text: Before enrolling you, Jeremiah, let me just say it would be greatly appreciated if your career at St. Bernard's was an uneventful one. Some students believe they can get expelled through disobedience and recklessness. What they don't understand is even after God's vengeance is meted out, He forgives. That His devastating anger is followed by His nurturing compassion. In a nutshell, St. Bernard's may punish you even for the slightest digression, but will never cast you out, even for the largest. So here you are, Jeremiah... here to stay!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's begin the enrollment, shall we?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . BERNARD'S - DAY Mrs. Bruce exits the building and approaches her car. She stops when she sees the '78 brown Volvo parked behind her. It's empty. She shrugs and gets into her car, driving off. Inside the Volvo Hawk, Trip, and Lex poke their heads up. The coast is clear so they can sit straight again. They stare up at a second story window where they see part of Jam's profile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They hear an ENGINE and turn to see a delivery truck labelled PIZZA PIG parking behind them. A DELIVERY BOY holding a pizza box steps out. Trip's mouth waters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seeing the boys, the delivery boy stops at the Volvo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hawk, Trip, and Lex exchange an anxious glance, then Hawk smiles. He is officially inspired as he turns to the boy.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Now, how are we gonna do this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gimme a second, dudes. Lemme think.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (licking his chops) Mmm, pizza...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, you guys know where... (looks at slip on box) Philip McNutly's office is?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, I'm Philip McNutly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Father TAPS his pencil looking impatiently at Jam who has totally withdrawn. He sits motionless staring into space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jam doesn't respond.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Jeremiah, are you aware you need to answer these questions, not just listen to them? Jeremiah?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please don't become difficult this early in your stay. I hate disciplining boys before I get to know them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: enters KNOCKING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The nun exits and a second later Hawk enters wearing Lex's baseball cap pulled down over his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The priest swivels his chair around and unlocks a box labelled "Donations." While he looks for cash, Hawk gives Jam a discreet kick in the shin. Jam looks up and recognizes Hawk. He then looks out the window seeing Trip, Lex, and the Volvo below. For the first time we see what Jam looks like with a big, fat, shit-eating grin on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Father McNulty swivels back around with a ten.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hawk takes the ten, tips the brim of the baseball cap and leaves, giving Jam a cautious wink as he goes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Father McNulty raises his eyebrows, then opens the pizza box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Father McNulty smiles, taking a big bite. Jam smiles for an entirely different reason. The priest mumbles with a mouthful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jam grins a bit feigning interest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Father McNulty GAGS sticking his pizza-covered tongue out. He pours himself a glass of wine and sucks it down looking concerned for the moment. Finally, he BELCHES.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Forgive me, Father. A young man here with a pizza for you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ah, yes! Send him in Sister Conimaria.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, what's the damage, pizza fellow?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ten even.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (whispering to Jam) If he offers you a slice, you're not the least bit hungry, check?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (whispering) Check.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Here's ten and I'm donating your tip to the church. The Lord thanks you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell the Big Guy not to mention it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And not a moment too soon. I'm famished. I hope you brought a lunch for yourself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, but I'm not hungry anyway.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well! It finally speaks. There's one barrier we've broken through.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, your coming here reminds me of a gospel called The Prodigal Son.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There was once a farmer who had two sons. Both grew up on the farm, helping their father until... (suddenly alarmed)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That was a very stale mushroom. (beat) Where was I?... Ah, yes, one day the elder son decided to leave the farm...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Hawk, Trip, and Lex look up at Father McNulty's window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look at their watches, then back at the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just then, INSANE LAUGHTER bellows from the window above.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Usually takes anywhere from ten minutes to half an hour.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shit! This is such a lousy view. How the hell are we gonna know when he's lit?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's lit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Father has undergone a metamorphosis. He's redder than a boiling lobster, his eyes bulge and he's laughing the deepest laugh a man can without risking psychological evaluation. Jam watches fascinated as the priest tries to finish the story. It's not every day you see a holy man tripping on shrooms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Father McNulty belly laughs so hard this time, he slides off his chair hitting his chin on the edge of his desk. He is in pain only momentarily, then laughs again, this time at his own pratfall. He hoists himself back into his chair. Hawk, Trip, and Lex suddenly barge into the office, followed by the outraged nun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Father McNulty laughs some more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jam gets up and all four boys exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The nun looks at the priest, deep concern in her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He lets out a belly laugh as the shocked nun runs from the office. Father McNulty laughs even louder at her behavior, POUNDING his fists on the desk, tears rolling down his cheeks, until... He suddenly glimpses at the painting of the Virgin Mary and abruptly stops laughing. What appears to be extreme contrition washes over his face as he moves closer to the painting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . VOLVO - DAY Hawk drives, Trip rides shotgun, Lex and Jam sit in the back. Stoked beyond belief, Jam POUNDS his drumsticks on the upholstery to the beat of a rockin' KISS tune playing on the 8-track.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lex taps Jam on the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lex hands him a paper bag with jeans and a tee-shirt in it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boys do their Three Stooges handshake and say "Curly!" Jam starts to change. Just then, the Volvo passes a two-tone Chevy Impala with luggage tied to the roof. The passenger in the back seat turns and spots Jam pulling off his pants. It's Beth. Her eyes bulge. Beth parents are in the front. Jam spots her and beams. Their eyes lock. She waves and starts to yell something, when... suddenly... BANG! The boys look out the driver's side of the car to see the rear hubcap rolling away. They've got a flat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The car fishtails and weaves but Hawk manages to pull over. The Chevy continues on, Beth gazing out the rear window sadly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (in mid-guffaw) So then, the younger one says, "But dad... I've been helping you on the farm my entire life! (belly laugh) You never once slaughtered the fatted calf for me!" And then... (more belly laughter) Forgive me, Jeremiah, it's just that... I've been telling this gospel for years and... I just now realized it's the work of some comedy mastermind! The Prodigal Son is a barrel of fucking monkeys!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You kids can't go in there!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's okay, we're old buds of Father McNulty... How's it hangin', padre?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A little to the right, pizza fellow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That was another dude. Anyway, we're here to take our bud Jam to the big satanic KISS concert tonight. Okay with you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (waving) Rock on!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (yelling after them) Give my regards to the guy with the really big tongue!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell are you doing, Sister Gonorrhea, waiting for a bus?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus H. Christ, look at all the colors.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, man, my mom is gonna send me to Alcatraz for this and I don't even care! I'm gonna see Peter Criss's drum solo!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not looking like that, Mr. Rogers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We got you a change of duds when we picked up the car.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Next stop: the 2:45 to Detroit Rock City!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (screams) My mom's hubcap!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shit! (looks at car clock) Anybody know how long it takes to fix a flat?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ON a status report. The 2:45 is now leaving. We see is Hawk, Trip, Lex, and Jam running alongside a train as it picks up speed by the second. They YELL for it to stop, but it's hopeless. The train is gone. So much for the 2:45.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lex looks at the speedometer. Hawk's got it up to ninety- five.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trip holds his stomach as we hear it GROWL. TRIP I'm starvin' and it's way past lunchtime.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trip spots a sign on the side of the road: Next Exit, Sandusky.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Jeezis, Hawk, can you at least keep it within twenty miles of the speed limit?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lex, am I gonna have to lock you in the trunk till we reach Detroit? Don't worry, these babies are built for speed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Totally. All I've had for chow was a packet of Pop Rocks and a Yoo-hoo.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's stop in Sandusky, Hawk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's in Sandusky?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pizza, and I been jones-in' for a pizza ever since we left St. Bernard's.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . VOLVO - DAY The boys chomp on their pizza slices and chug cans of Hawaiian Punch. Another raucous KISS tune BLARES. Behind them, a car horn starts HONKING rhythmically. Hawk looks into the rearview mirror and sees two guys and two girls in a tailgating Trans Am. The guys have 90 M.P.H. haircuts, tacky, wide-collared shirts, and massive amounts of jewelry on their necks. The girls wear 10-layer make-up, mega-jewelry, and hair teased so high, it touches the car's roof.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Only a car full of guidos and stellas would ride someone's ass on a two- lane road and beep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The speakers BLAST a DISCO SONG to which the four passengers sing. KENNY, the driver, HONKS to the disco beat. They're slightly older than our heroes and very full of themselves. Kenny and his best girl CHRISTINE sit in the front. BOBBY and BARBARA are in the back. It's a double disco date.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trip lifts a rubbery slice of pizza to his mouth and the top layer slides off PLOPPING into his lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trip grabs the wad of goop and throws it out the window.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Eyowch! This is one hot pizza!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Trip, huck that out before it stains the upholstery!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Just as the DISCO TUNE playing in the Trans Am hits the next chorus, a fistful of pizza SPLATTERS across the windshield. Freaked, Kenny swerves and zigzags all over the road. Righting himself, Kenny's entire family might as well have been insulted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns off the stereo and floors the accelerator, swerving into the left lane and passing the Volvo. Bobby is just now noticing the mess on the windshield. He starts to laugh.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Stop singing... NOW!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Kenny, look! There's a hunk of fawkin' cheese on your windsheel!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lex is looking at the mess on the Trans Am's windshield and the anger in the eyes of its passengers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Trans Am runs alongside the Volvo and Hawk turns to see Kenny pointing to the breakdown lane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hawk rolls up his window. Kenny yells, VOICE MUFFLED, and points to Hawk who pays absolutely no attention whatsoever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just then, SLAM, the Trans Am bangs up against the side of the Volvo pushing it onto the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Holy shit! We just pissed off the Incredible Hulk, his idiot half brother and two circus clowns.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stop the friggin' car NOW!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't you think we should at least pull over and offer to clean it off?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?! Are you mentally deranged, Jam?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the fuck!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (freaking out) The paint!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Trans Am muscles the Volvo into the breakdown lane. Parking the ass end of the Pontiac out a bit, Kenny blocks the Volvo in. Kenny and Bobby climb from their car and storm over to the boys. Hawk opens his door just as Kenny's hairy-knuckled hands pull him out through the window. He grabs Trip, yanking him out too. Bobby opens the back door and does the same with Lex and Jam. With a kid in each hand now, Kenny and Bobby SLAM the four boys against the Volvo in a line. The size difference between the burnouts and the guidos is painfully obvious now. Kenny and Bobby are Neanderthals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kenny hauls back and SLAPS the row of boys in the faces Three Stooges-style... WHACKWHACKWHACKWHACK!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trip, Lex, and Jam clutch their faces in pain. Hawk looks merely disenchanted as Kenny pokes a muscle-bound finger at his chest. Getting in Hawk's face, Kenny yammers loud and fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hawk starts to say "yes."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hawk is unimpressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kenny looks at Bobby and they exchange moronic grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hawk figured out that any answer he gives will be incorrect and has decided to wait till Kenny's done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christine snarls at Kenny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cold silence as Kenny replays Hawk's insult over in his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kenny's temper's rising faster than the price of gasoline. Hawk on the other hand is cooler than an Otter Pop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And with that, Kenny grabs himself a fistful of Hawk's long hair and pulls him over to the Trans Am. He wipes the pizza off with Hawk's hair, tugging Hawk's head up and down, back and forth. Hawk GRUNTS with each wipe, but doesn't give Kenny the satisfaction of hearing him scream. Trip, Lex, and Jam watch helplessly, trapped under Bobby's dull-witted, but equally threatening gaze. Kenny gets the last of the big chunks off his windshield and looks at his handiwork.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He throws Hawk to the ground and smiles at Bobby. Then, he suddenly hears the KISS tune coming from the Volvo. Uh-oh!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kenny clenches his jaws and walks up to the Volvo, reaching in the driver's door. Suddenly Jam grabs his wrist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kenny pushes Jam away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christine gets out of the car and starts walking down the highway, exiting the scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kenny meanwhile has his arm in the Volvo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kenny takes the 8-track from the car...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He flings it into the highway, where it is summarily smashed to bits under the wheels of a passing semi.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Do you realize the sheer, goddamn, unadulterated, undiluted, no holds barred, one hundred percent pure as Ivory Snow, absolutely friggin' STUPIDITY of what you just did?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, disco dude, it's cool...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lemme paint you a friggin' picture ahright? Imagine if you will a 1978 Pontiac Trans American in pristine condition. (beat) An appealing portrait, nesspah?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ! What's that spec on the windshield? Could it be a wad of melted mozzarella, tangy tomato sauce, and various friggin' meat products?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Could be.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And if it ain't cleaned off?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kenny, come on with the macho crap already. Like this kid could take you in a fight anyway.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (ignoring Christine) Answer me, hippie girl. And if the mess ain't cleaned off my car?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It could... bake on?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're a smart little homo, aren't you, hippie girl? But, while astounded at your nimble, friggin' insight, I still detect an issue hanging fire, namely: where does a sharp-witted faggot like yourself get off doing such a dopey thing like that there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No really, I'm perplexed. I mean, could you have done stupider if you were born without a FUCKIN' HEAD?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (using "oh" to mean "enough") Oh! With the language!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shut-up, Christine!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, Kenny? I don't mean to drain your keg or anything, but could you speed up this process? (beat) Don't get me wrong, we'd love to stand here and get shit on by the cast of Saturday Night Fever, but we're also on a schedule. So step on it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you gettin' wise with me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I'm dumber than a goddamn slug. Now can I please clean your windshield and leave without further ado?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Break his fawkin' legs, Kenny!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, you're dumb all right, you hairy ass punk. But please, allow me to clean the friggin' windshield. I insist.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There. Nice and clean.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, no, no, no! It's the fag band!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whoa! This is about pizza! Let's leave KISS out of it. Please.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A bunch of guys who make bad music, dress like freaks, and wear more make-up than all my sisters combined? These assholes must be stopped!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's it, Kenny! I'm leaving!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Christine! You googatz in the head or something? We're on the side of the freakin' highway!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let her go, Barbara, she'll come back to Kenny. She always does... (to Kenny) Right, Kenny?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kool and the Gang, now there's real music.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But this... is crap!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: a chunk of cartridge and a strand of mangled tape streaming from it as it sails back toward the side of the road, landing at Jam's feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UP to Jam's face. He raises his eyes and turns to the CAMERA, a single tear rolling down his cheek, just like the Indian in that "Keep America Beautiful" litter ad. Hawk rises and Kenny comes face-to-face with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hawk pulls a cigarette from his pocket and lights it. He blows some smoke in Kenny's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out of original material, Kenny goes for an old stand by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trip, Lex, and Jam exchange "uh-oh" glances. Meanwhile, Hawk's eyes glaze over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hawk reaches into his coat pocket and pulls out his mostly empty can of Hawaiian Punch, holding it discreetly at his side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kenny draws a blank, not being prepared for this one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kenny chuckles and looks at Bobby. They have a good little laugh... the homo's got balls! Then Kenny turns back to Hawk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hawk is a little mad now. He tosses his cigarette to the ground and squashes it like a bug under his sneaker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quick as a shot, Hawk SLAMS the bottom of the can into Kenny's nose, crushing it flat against his face. Hawaiian backwash spews from its tab hole like blood as Kenny falls backwards from the impact. He hits his head on the ground. Taking this as a cue... Trip whips out his wallet on a chain... Lex rips off his KISS belt... And Jam yanks out his drumsticks. As if choreographed, Trip swoops the wallet at Bobby's feet, snagging him around the ankles tightly with the chain. Lex THWAMS Bobby in the face with his big KISS belt buckle leaving a reversed, red, KISS logo branded in his forehead. Trip yanks the chain pulling Bobby off his feet. When he hits the ground, Jam's right there DRUMMING his balls. Bobby shrieks. Meanwhile, Hawk advances on Kenny who tries to get the can off his face, but it's stuck on looking like a pig's nose with fruit punch for snot. Hawk raises both his hands in Kenny's face, then executes the final insult... Hawk messes Kenny's hair. Kenny lets out a scream that comes from the bottom of his vanity. Hawk grabs Kenny by the ears and brings the guido's head swiftly against his kneecap. Kenny falls to the ground, unconscious on top of Bobby. Their heads collide knocking Bobby out cold. Terrified, Barbara leaps from the Trans Am and is cornered.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So. All that having been said and done, I believe we are ready for the final topic of discussion. Namely: Have you learned your lesson yet, puke?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, let's recap, shall we? You slapped all of us, yelled at me, used my head for a rag, threw me on the ground and tossed our LOVE GUN 8- track under the wheels of a passing semi. (puffing on cig) So, if the lesson was that you're a dick with ears and a really bad haircut, then, yes... I'd say we learned it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (beat, in disbelief) Excuse me, I'm a little deef-a- hearin'. Can you repeat yourself?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay. Ahem! You. Are. A. Dick. With. Ears. And. A. Really. Bad. Haircut.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, yeah...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's not what your mother said last night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not, huh? Well, then, tell me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...what exactly did my mother say last night?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You heard me, prick. What did my mother say last night?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, fagmo... I'll tell you what your mother said last night. (beat) She said that I was the fuck of her life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (very Clint Eastwood) How would you like a nice Hawaiian Punch?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smirking) Sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not so fast, stella.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Kenny, Bobby, and Barbara are now tied to the guardrail with Jam's white corduroy pants, geeky belt, and plaid shirt. Kenny and Bobby rest their unconscious heads on each of Barbara's shoulders. Hawk, Trip, Lex, and Jam look down at the two guidos and the stella, snickering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hawk grabs a cinderblock off the side of the road, walking up to the Trans Am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hawk puts the rock on the Trans Am's accelerator letting the engine WHINE in protest. (Again we are cautious not to show the guidos' faces.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He throws the Trans Am into drive. All who are conscience listen to the brief SCREECH, then watch the Trans Am as it barrels without a driver into the woods skirting the highway. It races into ditches, bounces off trees, and SPLASHES through ponds, all Smokey and the Bandit-like. The disco-mobile ramps off the edge of an embankment, tumbles down a steep, rocky incline breaking apart along the way, and finally, BOOM! It explodes on final impact. The boys all look at each other and shrug. Hawk walks back to the Volvo and gets in. Trip, Lex, and Jam follow suit and pile in as well. Lex shouts back to Barbara.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: When they wake up, they're gonna come looking for you jerks. You best hope they don't find you, cause if they do, they're gonna kick your asses.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right, stella, and we'll deserve it. But let's really make it worth their while.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: By the way, when Kenny wakes up could you give him a message for me. Tell him, quote, Kool and the gang bite my bag, motherfucker, unquote.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, thanks for letting us draw from your ample make-up supply. You must have the entire Revlon factory in your purse!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . We now see them from the front. Lo-and-behold, Kenny has been made-up like Gene Simmons, Bobby like Paul Stanley. Whoever finds them is gonna get the wrong idea about their musical taste... and kick their asses all over again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . VOLVO - DAY Hawk starts the engine and takes off. Trip pulls a baggie of weed and some rolling papers out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jam points out at the road ahead to Christine. She's a few hundred feet away walking sadly in the breakdown lane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hawk slows down, turning into the breakdown lane, travelling about two miles per hour. Christine doesn't notice as they edge closer to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pause.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Very funny. I hope you choke!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, look, it's that girl.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's no girl. That's a stella.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stella or no stella, we should pull over and help her out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh no, Jam. I'm not falling for that twice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, couldn't you slow down so I can at least state my case, Hawk? If you don't like it, you can speed up and I'll never mention it again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is it with you, Jam? You got a thing for that... thing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's a teenage girl walking on the side of the highway. They make very scary movies that start out like that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, they may not make movies about four dudes going to a KISS concert. But if they ever did, the four dudes most certainly would not stop and pick up a stranded disco bunny.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Unless there was gonna be a scene where the disco bunny blows the four dudes on the way to the show.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Christine sits between Jam and Lex in the back SNAPPING gum. Jam and Lex stare at her like cats looking at a fish bowl. Hawk looks in the rearview mirror at Christine checking herself in a compact. She swathes on some 7-Up flavored, Bonnie Bell lip gloss. Trip meanwhile twirls the joint he's just finished rolling in his mouth, sealing it. He winks at her disgustingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trying to be suave, Lex moves in close, putting the make on her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She pushes him away. Jam laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trip lights the joint and takes a lungful of pot. He passes it to Lex and the joint begins to make its rounds with the exception of Christine. The car starts to fill with smoke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christine processes this remark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trip looks confused, then smiles thinking she paid him a compliment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All, Christine included, pause to think about what that comment was supposed to mean. Lex takes a hit off the joint.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hawk and Trip immediately bust into the giggles and it doesn't take long for Lex and Jam to follow suit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christine succumbs to the contagious giggle epidemic and the whole car gets a great laugh for a while. They finally calm down again and wipe tears from their eyes. Lex still has the joint now as Christine looks at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lex smiles despite himself and holds the weed out to her as we...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, great. I just hitched a ride with a bunch of potheads... I'm hooking up with some people at this funky place in downtown Detroit called Disco Inferno. Mind droppin' me there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smirks) What's it worth to you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grossed out) What the hell is that supposed to mean?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It doesn't mean anything. Don't pay attention to him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rolls his eyes) Disco Inferno? Disco's infernal morelike.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your clothes may say disco, but your eyes say rock 'n' roll, baby.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, your tee-shirt may say rock 'n' roll, but your breath says pepperoni, baby.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (frustrated) So, are you, like, gonna polish our nobs, or what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (thoroughly offended) What? That's disgusting!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Trip! That's so fuckin' rude, man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, quit bein' the wussy, sensitive guy to impress her, Jam. She's obviously not gonna put out. She's a fuckin' tease.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tease? What the hell did I do to tease you mongoloids?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You got in the car, didn't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, God, how calculating of me to lead you all on like that after you offered me a ride in the middle of nowhere.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whatever... stella.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The name's Christine, not stella. And there's no need to be such pigs just cause I prefer Donna Summer or KC and the Sunshine Boys or the Village People over KISS?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with disdain) The Village People? They're fags! You're a fag hag!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, Hawk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can take care of myself, but thanks anyway, germ.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jam.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whatever. (to Hawk) Okay, Joe Burnout, let's get one thing straight here. As far as I'm concerned good tunes is good tunes, be it disco or rock or polka or whatever have you, regardless of the category. True, if I had to choose, I'd pick the category labelled disco because I happen to enjoy dancing. Disco is just easier to dance to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You call that John Travolta/Denny Terio shit dancing? I wouldn't dance like that in private if you paid me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Disco blows dogs for quarters.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now there's an intelligently biting remark wrought with wit and irony.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, if you don't like that one, maybe you'll think it's funny when we throw your ass out the goddamn car!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, why don't you put your money where your mouth is?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why don't you kiss my hairy crack?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why don't you bend over, you're looking right at it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (holding in smoke) That last remark fell about 30 yards away from making any sense whatsoever.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (realization) Hey, you're right. "Bend over you're looking right at it?!" (starts to laugh) What's that supposed to mean anyway?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Man, this is some kickass shit! (beat) Gimme a hit off that jay will ya?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Volvo passing a big sign that says: "Welcome to Michigan, the Great Lakes State." The Volvo racing toward the Detroit skyline. Detroit landmarks: The General Motors Building, the Ford Building, Motown Records, and finally...
direction.name: direction

result.heading: "YOU GOTTA LOSE YOUR MIND IN DETROIT ROCK CITY"

direction.raw_text: where thousands of fans in KISS tees gather, waiting for its doors to open. Unbelievable traffic stretches to an intersection at which stand four key landmarks... a cathedral, a convenience store, a parking lot, and a male strip joint. They face one another, each on its own corner. A gigantic sign on the auditorium's facade flashes the commandment, "YOU GOTTA LOSE YOUR MIND IN DETROIT ROCK CITY" over and over again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sun hangs low on this day as the Volvo sits in traffic, passing Cobo Hall. Movement is nearly impossible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: cram every square foot of open macadam, pushing through the jammed cars. STREET VENDORS hawk KISS souvenirs from tee-shirts to pennants. Some are in stands along the sidewalk. Others come right up to car windows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christine is fast asleep between Jam and Lex.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All look ahead. COBO Hall. A HALO GLOW forms around the building accompanied by a CHOIR OF ANGELS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One block on the left is the W.A.R.P. tower.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The opening to the Carpenters' "TOP OF THE WORLD" begins.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Man, that weed knocked Christine on her ass. She's sleeping like a baby stella.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (whispers lustfully) Let's lift up her shirt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pointing out windshield) There it is!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in reverence) We made it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Curly driving, Hawk. We still got two hours to spare.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ample time to grab our tickets at the station. See, up ahead. W.A.R.P.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Look at the front entrance! A car's pulling out. The parking space from heaven. God is surely smiling down upon us tonight, dudes.

dialogue.raw_text: Kind of funny, I thought He'd be pissed as hell at me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .A.R.P. TOWER ELEVATOR - NIGHT "TOP OF THE WORLD" continues, playing through the speaker of the ascending elevator inside which Hawk, Trip, Lex, and Jam stand. They watch the numbers climb, smiling.

dialogue.raw_text: What was that D.J.'s name again?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, I'll remember it till the day I die. His name was... Simpleton the Simian? No, Samson Samoan... No, simply, similar...

dialogue.raw_text: Simple Simon?

direction.raw_text: They all enter and stand at Simple Simon's desk.

dialogue.raw_text: The one and only. But can you kids hurry this up? I'm due at Coco Hall in half an hour for the warm-up.

dialogue.raw_text: Your name isn't Trip is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Hawk, Trip, Lex, and Jam sit in the tiny producer's booth with Simon who fast forwards a reel-to-reel tape through some very loud, high-speed conversation and bits of music. Looking at the footage counter on the tape player, he slows down at a certain point and lets the boys listen to this: The CLICK of a phone being answered.

direction.raw_text: Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pause.

dialogue.raw_text: Simple Simon on the Rock, go caller.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello? Is this me? I'm Trip. Am I on the air?

dialogue.raw_text: I should hang up on you right now, but you're the right caller so answer quick or get your battleship sunk. What are the names of the four members of KISS?

dialogue.raw_text: Gene Klein, Stanley Eisen, Paul Frehley, and Peter...Criscula! Yeah, that's it!

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I did?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, you did!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeeeehaaawww!! This is totally fuckin' curly, man! Thank you God!

dialogue.raw_text: Whoa, easy, Trip, this is radio, not "Taxi Driver." Now listen up cause this next part is crucial. Stay on the line so we can get your full name, information, and...

direction.raw_text: Simple Simon stops the tape and looks at the boys who look like they've just been served a life sentence behind bars.

dialogue.raw_text: Trip? Trip? Oh, man, you didn't hang up on me did you? Trip? (beat) What kind of total moron would hang...?

direction.raw_text: .A.R.P. TOWER ELEVATOR - NIGHT Hawk, Trip, Lex, and Jam ride back down the elevator sipping NeHi sodas, watching the floor numbers get lower and lower. Terry Jack's immortal hit "SEASONS IN THE SUN" plays over the elevator speaker.

direction.raw_text: Trip looks away from the rest, ashamed.

direction.raw_text: Jam looks at his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hawk, Trip, and Lex cringe.

direction.raw_text: The doors to the elevator open and the boys step out.

dialogue.raw_text: Well, here we are, dudes. One hour and thirty minutes away from the concert of the century... ticketless. All thanks to Wile E. Coyote, Super- Fucking Genius over here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Really, Trip, can we bore holes in your head and use it as a bong so it actually does us some good for a change?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fuck you, Lex! This whole thing wouldn't have happened if it wasn't for you jinxing us. I just made an honest mistake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, I'm sorry, Trip. What you made was a big, brainless, pile of horse shit. No offense.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Guys, GUYS! Come on, if this is anyone's fault, it's mine. I was the one who grabbed Trip's jacket by mistake. It's my fault and I apologize.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please, Jam, we're trying to vent some hostility here. Sure the whole thing may be your fault, but who's gonna get pissed off at you?

dialogue.raw_text: Sometimes I think I don't deserve friends as good as you guys.

dialogue.raw_text: Really, Jam, you tryin' to make us barf?

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, it's like you're possessed by The Flying Nun, or something.

direction.raw_text: .A.R.P. TOWER - NIGHT COBO Hall looms up ahead. Hawk, Trip, Lex, and Jam enter the sidewalk. A thickening CROWD of KISS fans continually meander by. On their way to the car, they suddenly hear a WOMAN'S VOICE bellowing through a megaphone from somewhere down the street. After a moment they see the voice's source.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: has congregated about forty feet ahead and their LEADER, her back toward the boys, yells to the group through her bullhorn. Flying above them all is a large banner reading: "MATMOK, Mothers Against The Music Of KISS."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The group cheers as the KISS FANS milling around them pretty much ignore the whole MATMOK spectacle. Lex looks away from the MATMOKS and into the street. We can't see what he sees, but we can tell he's alarmed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all look at Lex.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hawk, Trip, and Jam look at their parking spot to see a beat- up Dodge Dart sitting there instead of the Volvo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lex is developing a look of resolve. This is Detroit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jam holds up a ten keeping his mouth shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trip smiles proudly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hawk points to the intersection where the church, the male strip joint, the parking lot, and the Smiley Mart are located.

direction.raw_text: The leader's gaze finally falls upon Jam. He lets out a GASP. Yes, the leader is Mrs. Bruce. So this was her church meeting. She freezes when she sees her son; her jaw slackens. Meanwhile Jam looks stunned beyond comprehension.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Bruce quickly hands the megaphone to another MATMOK member, who picks up where Mrs. Bruce left off. Jam looks around for someplace to run and hide, but it's too late. Mrs. Bruce slices through the crowd of KISS fans and grabs Jam by the ear. He yelps.

dialogue.raw_text: Welcome to the first open meeting of MATMOK, Mothers Against The Music Of KISS!"
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh... dudes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (ignoring Lex) Now there's a woman who totally abuses the privilege of motherhood.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can see that, bright boy. What happened to it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was stolen!

dialogue.raw_text: Now listen up. Here's the game plan.

dialogue.raw_text: (on a roll) ...I mean, my mom's got insurance. What's the worst thing she could do? Ground me for the entire year? I can handle that...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cool, bro, now listen up...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...Holy shit! I am in absolute trouble! I never should have let you drive, man! Absolute fuckin' trouble!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, shut the fuck up, Lex! Now, then, step number one, we find us a scalper. I got... (takes out KISS money clip) twenty-five.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Twenty-five more'n I got.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All I got is five. The rest is in the Volvo.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh-uh. Don't tell us, Jam. Just show us.

dialogue.raw_text: So maybe we got enough for one ticket. Fuck!

dialogue.raw_text: Waitaminit, dudes! I got it! We find four really small kids, beat the shit outta them and steal their tickets. What do you think?

dialogue.raw_text: (sarcastic) Brilliance, Trip. Sheer brilliance. Give Albert Einstein here the Nobel Prize.

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, one of us sneaks in, gets four ticket stubs off some kids in the audience, comes back out, and we all "re-enter" the concerto. Voila!

dialogue.raw_text: Still too risky for my money. (looking at watch) We're running out of time here. This is KISS! A victory for one is a victory for the team. I'm sure I can barter with a scalper, but if you dudes think you got better plans, go for it. We'll reconvene at that intersection...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...at twenty-thirty hours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: One more time in English.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For the next hour and a half it's every dude for himself. Try to get at least one ticket and at 8:30 P.M. we'll meet over there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (inspired) Wait! I know how we can get in!

dialogue.raw_text: Jam, shut-up! You're not allowed to speak, remember? Go use whatever femmy idea you have to get yourself a ticket or four. I don't wanna hear it.

dialogue.raw_text: (sadly) But... my plan involves all four of us acting together.

dialogue.raw_text: See you at 8:30, Jam. Later. (to Lex and Trip) Dudes? Later.

dialogue.raw_text: Look around you tonight, mothers! Look at all the young faces! They smile and laugh but their eyes have lost all hope! Not one among them appears to possess the love and fear of God... This satanic group KISS has stolen their souls.

dialogue.raw_text: Oh... dear... Lord!!

Behind him stands the marquee for IT'S RAINING MEN, the male strip joint. A DISCO SONG comes from inside. Just when it looks like Hawk's given up, a VOICE is heard above.

They seem to like what they see. Hawk looks nervously at the carnivorous faces leering at his package first, his ass after. What the hell is he doing? Hawk reluctantly climbs onto the stage and the gals start CLAPPING to the song. He faces them and starts gyrating his drunken hips at them, feeling no confidence whatsoever, until... The CHEERS start to ECHO and the pulsing lights begin to hurt his eyes. Hawk watches the world proceed to spin faster than the disco ball above his head. He stops gyrating and clutches his stomach. BELCHING. Uh-oh. Hawk spots an almost-empty beer pitcher one of the CHEERING- IN-SLOW-MOTION women holds above her head. He runs up to the edge of the stage, grabs the pitcher, and PUKES. The cheering and music come to a grinding halt. You can hear a pin drop as Hawk yacks his guts out into the beer pitcher. It goes on for an excruciatingly long time, then finally stops. Hawk looks up at the hundreds of astonished eyes staring at him. He wipes his mouth, then a look of ease washes over his face.

The women come out of their dumbstruck comas and reluctantly start CLAPPING again. Hawk pulls off his jacket and twirls it over his head Roger Daltry style. Then he pulls it back down and tosses it into the crowd. The women actually fight over it. Encouraged, Hawk then peels off his KISS Army tee-shirt and hurls it at the women, who SQUEAL with delight. Sure, he may be scrawny, but they don't mind. This lad's got personality. Adrenaline pumping, confidence building, Hawk starts playing the crowd of very responsive ladies. He unbuttons his jeans first. Then, leaving them on, he does an "air guitar" medley: Chuck Berry, ZZ Top, Angus Young from AC/DC, and Elvis Costello in six easy steps. Hawk finishes off with a Pete Townshend windmill, shaking his ass at his audience in mid-strum, then licks his finger and touches one of his cheeks: "hot stuff" (he does this in a manly way of course). Then Hawk pauses to adjust what looks to be his underwear bunching up in his crack. The women WHOO-HOO. He segues into a Mick Jagger rooster strut and the ladies go ga-ga. He makes the sign of the horns with each hand and wiggles a protruding tongue like Gene Simmons. The gals scream in orgastic joy. Then, Hawk goes for the gold. Yes, he does the Fonzie dance! The women are now overcome by sheer animal lust. Hawk's whipped his audience into a frenzied pack of bitches in heat. Amanda smirks and sucks from her little drink straw suggestively. direction.raw_text: They're seeing God! The show is spectacular. The costumes. The make-up. The blitzkrieg of pyrotechnics. The flashing KISS sign. Ace's smoking guitar. Gene's spewing fire. Paul's rockin' vocals. Peter's kick-ass beat. Then, something really weird happens. The crowd behind the boys heaves forward. Jam is pushed like a twig in a flood and over the shoulders of those in front of him. Purely by accident, he is thrown onto the stage landing on his stomach between Paul and Gene. Just before Peter's drum solo is about to start. Gene, Paul, and Ace silence their instruments. Peter throws his drumstick into the air intending to catch it when it comes down. But the sight of Jam landing on the stage distracts him. All is mute as Peter misses the drumstick. It hits the outside edge of one of the drums. Thinking fast, Jam grabs one of his drumsticks out of his sock and tosses it to Peter. It tumbles through the air in SLOW MOTION with a LOW, WHOOPING, HELICOPTER SOUND. We see the word "Mystery" clearly as it twirls. Instantly, it's caught in Peter Criss's hand and he brings it down on his drum not missing a beat. The song resumes with all its fury as Peter's drum kit ascends on a hydraulic platform. Jam scrambles from the stage and leaps back into the audience barely missing the claws of some security guards. The four friends pound on each other with unbridled, teenage exuberance. Will it ever get any better than this?
direction.name: direction
